timelineTitle: Fetal Development: From Conception to Birth

events.title: Fertilization
events.description: A single spermatozoon penetrates the ovum’s zona pellucida, triggering cortical granule release and the completion of meiosis II; within seconds the zygote forms, restoring the diploid chromosome complement and initiating the first mitotic cycle.
events.prompt: Illustration style: A detailed image of Fertilization. hand-drawn illustration style, detailed linework, rich textures, artistic composition, storybook aesthetic. 21th century period detail, historically accurate. Balanced composition, centered focal point, clear visual storytelling. SERIES CONSISTENCY: Use a consistent documentary photography style: soft, even lighting from above (like a medical/scientific photograph), neutral background (white or light gray), centered subject composition, same scale and magnification level, clinical/educational aesthetic. Maintain this exact visual approach across all images in the series - same lighting direction, same background color, same composition style, same level of detail. Images should look like they were photographed in the same scientific documentation session. No text, no words, no written content, no labels. Pure visual scene without any readable text or letters
events.promptFromStep3: Anchor: Medically-accurate, high-detail illustration style documentary series; soft, even overhead lighting with gentle rim-light to outline fetal forms; palette of muted rose, amethyst, and translucent ivory with subdued amber accents for organ emphasis; every stage centered in frame at life-size scale, slight 15° caudal angle for womb-like perspective; background a seamless, desaturated lilac-gray gradient that fades to pure white at bottom third, maintaining consistent negative space for timeline annotations. A translucent ovum surrounded by radiating spermatozoa, one sperm mid-penetration through the zona pellucida, cortical granules visible as tiny luminous beads.

events.title: Blastocyst Formation
events.description: Approximately five days post-fertilization, the conceptus transforms into a fluid-filled blastocyst: an inner cell mass destined to become the embryo proper is clearly delineated from the surrounding trophoectoderm that will generate placental tissues.
events.prompt: Anchor: Medically-accurate, high-detail illustration style documentary series; soft, even overhead lighting with gentle rim-light to outline fetal forms; palette of muted rose, amethyst, and translucent ivory with subdued amber accents for organ emphasis; every stage centered in frame at life-size scale, slight 15° caudal angle for womb-like perspective; background a seamless, desaturated lilac-gray gradient that fades to pure white at bottom third, maintaining consistent negative space for timeline annotations. events.title: Implantation
events.description: The expanded blastocyst breaches the uterine luminal epithelium, orienting its embryonic pole toward the endometrial surface; trophoblastic cells rapidly invade maternal decidua, anchoring the conceptus and establishing early nutrient exchange.
events.prompt: Illustration style: A detailed image of Implantation. hand-drawn illustration style, detailed linework, rich textures, artistic composition, storybook aesthetic. 21th century period detail, historically accurate. events.title: Germinal Stage
events.description: During the germinal phase, rapid cleavage divisions produce a morula, followed by blastulation and the differentiation of trophoblast and embryoblast lineages; concomitantly, secretory changes in the endometrium secure an implantation-ready environment.

events.title: Embryonic Stage Begins
events.description: At the conclusion of implantation, the bilaminar embryonic disc is established; the amniotic and yolk sac cavities balloon outward, demarcating the definitive embryonic stage and setting the coordinate system for all future morphogenesis.
events.prompt: Anchor: Medically-accurate, high-detail illustration style documentary series; soft, even overhead lighting with gentle rim-light to outline fetal forms; palette of muted rose, amethyst, and translucent ivory with subdued amber accents for organ emphasis; every stage centered in frame at life-size scale, slight 15° caudal angle for womb-like perspective; background a seamless, desaturated lilac-gray gradient that fades to pure white at bottom third, maintaining consistent negative space for timeline annotations. events.title: Neural Tube Formation
events.description: By the end of week 3, neural plate folds elevate and converge along the dorsal midline, fusing to form the neural tube; this structure will subsequently segregate into forebrain, midbrain, and hindbrain vesicles.
events.prompt: Anchor: Medically-accurate, high-detail illustration style documentary series; soft, even overhead lighting with gentle rim-light to outline fetal forms; palette of muted rose, amethyst, and translucent ivory with subdued amber accents for organ emphasis; every stage centered in frame at life-size scale, slight 15° caudal angle for womb-like perspective; background a seamless, desaturated lilac-gray gradient that fades to pure white at bottom third, maintaining consistent negative space for timeline annotations. events.title: Heart Development
events.description: In the fourth gestational week, paired endocardial tubes fuse into a single primitive heart tube that begins rhythmic contractions; looping morphogenesis repositions future atrial and ventricular segments, establishing the four-chambered blueprint.
events.prompt: Anchor: Medically-accurate, high-detail illustration style documentary series; soft, even overhead lighting with gentle rim-light to outline fetal forms; palette of muted rose, amethyst, and translucent ivory with subdued amber accents for organ emphasis; every stage centered in frame at life-size scale, slight 15° caudal angle for womb-like perspective; background a seamless, desaturated lilac-gray gradient that fades to pure white at bottom third, maintaining consistent negative space for timeline annotations. events.title: Limb Bud Formation
events.description: During early week 5, lateral plate mesoderm proliferates to produce paddle-shaped limb buds; apical ectodermal ridges secrete fibroblast growth factors, orchestrating proximal-to-distal outgrowth of future arms and legs.

events.title: Embryonic Stage Ends
events.description: By the conclusion of week 8, all major external and internal structures are delineated; the embryo exhibits a recognizably human form, transitioning phenotypic terminology from embryo to fetus as organ rudiments achieve basic segmentation.

events.title: Fetal Stage Begins
events.description: The fetal stage commences with accelerated interstitial growth; weight increases exponentially while relative head size diminishes, producing proportionate cephalocaudal and proximodistal dimensions characteristic of early human morphology.

events.title: Rapid Growth
events.description: Between weeks 9 and 12, crown-rump length triples; hepatocytes assume hematopoietic dominance, renal glomeruli initiate filtration, and spontaneous limb movements become ultrasonographically apparent.

events.title: Brain Development
events.description: Neurogenesis peaks as radial glia guide neuronal migration; sulcation begins with the emergence of the interhemispheric fissure, and synaptogenesis lays the groundwork for future cortical circuitry.

events.title: Sensory Development
events.description: Otic and optic vesicles complete differentiation into the membranous labyrinth and retinal layers; taste papillae and olfactory bulbs form, enabling rudimentary chemosensory and auditory responsiveness to maternal cues.

events.title: Movement
events.description: By week 16, neuromuscular junctions mature sufficiently to generate coordinated limb flexion and extension; these movements, initially imperceptible to the mother, are readily visualized on real-time ultrasound.

events.title: Organ Maturation
events.description: Alveolar type II cells commence surfactant synthesis; hepatic enzyme systems mature toward postnatal metabolic competence, and renal tubular mechanisms refine electrolyte and water balance essential for extrauterine homeostasis.

events.title: Bone Development
events.description: Secondary ossification centers appear in long-bone epiphyses; cancellous bone progressively mineralizes, and the fetal skeleton achieves sufficient structural integrity to withstand external compression forces encountered during labor.

events.title: Skin and Hair Development
events.description: Keratinocytes stratify to form a protective epidermal barrier; sebaceous glands secrete vernix caseosa, while follicular maturation produces lanugo hair that regulates epidermal adherence of the lubricating biofilm.

events.title: Third Trimester Begins
events.description: Initiating week 27, the fetus reaches viability thresholds; pulmonary vascular resistance declines, retinal vascularization nears completion, and subcutaneous adipose deposition rounds previously angular facial and bodily contours.

events.title: Birth
events.description: Partitioned pulmonary expansion, umbilical vessel constriction, and the newborn’s first inspiratory effort collectively effectuate the transition from placental to pulmonary respiration, completing the continuum from fertilized ovum to independently functioning neonate.
